intro: Elekmania haitiensis, commonly known as the Haitian elecampane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Haiti. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
